Key Arguments: The bill allows the government to define what is considered truth, which could lead to censorship of religious and political speech.
The government and mainstream media are exempt from the rules of the bill, creating a double standard.
The bill contradicts Article 19 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, which protects freedom of opinion and expression.
The Australian Human Rights Commission has criticized the bill for potentially restricting public debate and enforcing ideological conformity.
The bill represents government overreach and imposes draconian controls on free speech.
Notable Quotes: The Bill will give the sitting government of the day the power to silence religious and political speech that contradicts prevailing ideologies and political messaging.
The measures proposed in this Bill are a direct contradiction to Article 19 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights.
This Bill would impose some of the most draconian controls to free speech in the Western world.
